title: Implicitly Defined - finding points on a graph

content.question: In the <math alttext="x y"><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math>-plane, an implicitly defined function is given by <math alttext="2 x y plus y cubed equals 16"><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi><mo>+</mo><msup><mi>y</mi><mn>3</mn></msup><mo>=</mo><mn>16</mn></math>. Which of the following tables contains points <math alttext="open parentheses x comma y close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi></mrow></mfenced></math> that are on the graph of the implicitly defined function?

choices.label:
<math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math>
 <math alttext="negative 2"><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></math>
 <math alttext="0"><mn>0</mn></math>
 <math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math>

<math alttext="y"><mi>y</mi></math>
 <math alttext="2.784"><mn>2.784</mn></math>
 <math alttext="2.520"><mn>2.520</mn></math>
 <math alttext="2.256"><mn>2.256</mn></math>

<math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math>
 <math alttext="negative 2"><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></math>
 <math alttext="0"><mn>0</mn></math>
 <math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math>

<math alttext="y"><mi>y</mi></math>
 <math alttext="3.043"><mn>3.043</mn></math>
 <math alttext="2.256"><mn>2.256</mn></math>
 <math alttext="2.000"><mn>2.000</mn></math>

<math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math>
 <math alttext="negative 2"><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></math>
 <math alttext="0"><mn>0</mn></math>
 <math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math>

<math alttext="y"><mi>y</mi></math>
 <math alttext="3.043"><mn>3.043</mn></math>
 <math alttext="2.520"><mn>2.520</mn></math>
 <math alttext="2.000"> <mn>2.000</mn> </math>

<math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math>
 <math alttext="negative 2"><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></math>
 <math alttext="0"><mn>0</mn></math>
 <math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math>

<math alttext="y"><mi>y</mi></math>

content.answer:
<math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math>

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Construct equivalent graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations of functions that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context, with and without technology.
